episodeTitle: Hunter Sanji Makes an Entrance? Elegy for a Lying Wolf!
episodeTitleJapanese: 狩人サンジ登場?嘘つき狼に贈る挽歌
episodeTitleRomanized: Gariudo Sanji tōjō? Usotsuki ōkami ni okuru banka
description: Sanji arrives just in time to save Sogeking from Jabra's deadly attack and begins their battle. Meanwhile, Franky rescues an unconscious Chopper from the sea, and Chimney shows him the way to the Gates of Justice. Zoro continues his intense fight with Kaku while Luffy battles Rob Lucci.

events.title: Jabra Attacks Sogeking with Jusshigan
events.description: Jabra reveals his deceptive nature by tricking Sogeking into believing he's a pacifist who hates violence. After Sogeking lowers his guard, Jabra brutally attacks him with Jusshigan, a powerful Ten Finger Pistol technique, slamming Sogeking's head into the wall.
events.significance: This demonstrates Jabra's cunning and ruthless fighting style, using psychological warfare before physical attacks. It also shows Usopp's vulnerability when facing CP9 agents directly, setting up the need for Sanji's intervention.

quotes.text: I really hate blood and fighting, you know...
quotes.speaker: Jabra
quotes.context: Jabra's lie to make Sogeking lower his guard before attacking

events.title: Sanji Arrives and Rescues Sogeking
events.description: Just as Jabra is about to deliver a killing blow to the beaten Sogeking, Sanji dramatically arrives and kicks Jabra across the room, sending the wolf-man flying into the wall. Sanji's timely rescue saves Usopp's life.
events.significance: This marks Sanji's dramatic entrance into his major battle of the Enies Lobby arc. It demonstrates the crew's support system and Sanji's role as protector, while setting up one of his most iconic fights.

quotes.text: Don't worry, I've got this. You just focus on getting to Robin.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji reassuring Sogeking after saving him from Jabra

events.title: Sanji Introduces Himself as 'The Hunter'
events.description: When Jabra asks who Sanji is, Sanji introduces himself as 'The Hunter,' creating a deliberate fairy tale reference. This is a clever nod to Little Red Riding Hood, with Sanji as the hunter and Jabra (in his wolf form) as the big bad wolf.
events.significance: This establishes the thematic framework for their battle, referencing the classic fairy tale. The Little Red Riding Hood imagery foreshadows Jabra's deceptive nature and Sanji's role in defeating the 'wolf.'

quotes.text: Who am I? I'm the hunter.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's introduction to Jabra, referencing Little Red Riding Hood

events.title: Sanji Checks on Sogeking's Condition
events.description: After kicking Jabra away, Sanji immediately checks on Sogeking to make sure he's okay. Despite Sogeking apologizing for not being strong enough to handle Jabra, Sanji brushes it off and tells him not to worry about it.
events.significance: This moment shows Sanji's caring nature and his trust in his crewmates. He doesn't criticize Usopp for losing, instead encouraging him to focus on rescuing Robin. It reinforces the bonds between the Straw Hat crew members.

quotes.text: I'm sorry, Sanji. I couldn't handle him...
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Usopp apologizing to Sanji for losing to Jabra

quotes.text: Don't worry about it. As long as you're okay, that's what matters.
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Sanji vs Jabra Battle Begins
events.description: Sanji tells Sogeking to leave Jabra's key to him and to continue toward Robin. He assures Sogeking that if he gets there, he can definitely rescue Robin. With that, the battle between Sanji and Jabra officially begins.
events.significance: This marks the start of one of Sanji's most important battles in the series, where he will later debut his Diable Jambe technique. The fight showcases Sanji's combat evolution and his determination to save Robin.

quotes.text: Leave his key to me. If you get there, you can definitely save Robin!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji taking responsibility for fighting Jabra and trusting Usopp to reach Robin

events.title: Jabra's Robin Sister Lie - Little Red Riding Hood Reference
events.description: Jabra attempts to deceive Sanji by claiming that Robin is his long-lost younger sister, showing her in imagery wearing a red-hooded cloak. He tosses his key at Sanji's feet, begging him to rescue her. This is a direct reference to Little Red Riding Hood, with Jabra playing the deceptive wolf.
events.significance: This scene continues the Little Red Riding Hood fairy tale motif established earlier. The imagery of Robin in a red hood while Jabra is in wolf form creates a clear visual parallel to the classic tale. It also demonstrates Jabra's tactical use of deception in combat.

quotes.text: Robin... she's my long-lost younger sister! Please, you have to save her!
quotes.speaker: Jabra
quotes.context: Jabra's fabricated story attempting to trick Sanji

events.title: Sanji Sees Through Jabra's Deception
events.description: As Jabra prepares to attack the seemingly distracted Sanji, Sanji suddenly delivers a powerful kick to Jabra's chin, revealing that he never fell for the lie. He asks Jabra if he really thought such an obvious deception would work.
events.significance: This moment shows Sanji's growth and tactical awareness. Unlike his typical weakness for women-related stories, Sanji immediately sees through Jabra's manipulation, demonstrating his focus during serious battles. It establishes that Sanji won't fall for psychological tricks.

quotes.text: Did you really think I'd fall for such an obvious lie?
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji revealing he saw through Jabra's deception while kicking him

events.title: Franky Rescues Chopper from the Sea
events.description: Franky manages to pull an unconscious Tony Tony Chopper out of the water. Chopper has completely returned to his normal form after his Monster Point rampage. Franky quickly works to expel the water from Chopper's lungs, reviving him.
events.significance: This moment saves Chopper's life after his dangerous use of Monster Point against Kumadori. It shows Franky's quick thinking and care for the crew, despite being a relatively new ally. Chopper's recovery is crucial for the crew's continued mission.

events.title: Chimney and Gonbe Show the Way to Gates of Justice
events.description: As Franky works to revive Chopper, Chimney and her rabbit Gonbe appear and inform Franky that they know how to get to the Gates of Justice. This provides Franky with the crucial information he needs to intercept Robin before she leaves Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Chimney's knowledge of Enies Lobby's secret passages proves invaluable to the rescue mission. This demonstrates how even minor characters can play crucial roles in the story, and it advances the plot toward the climactic confrontation at the Gates of Justice.

quotes.text: We know how to get to the Gates of Justice! Follow us!
quotes.speaker: Chimney
quotes.context: Chimney offering to guide Franky to intercept Robin

events.title: Franky Races Toward the Gates of Justice
events.description: Franky begins running down the halls toward the Gates of Justice, hoping that one of the two keys he possesses (from Fukurou and Kumadori) will unlock Robin's handcuffs before she reaches the gates. Chimney follows behind, painting arrows to mark the path.
events.significance: This begins the race against time to reach Robin. Franky's possession of two keys increases the chances of success, building tension for the eventual confrontation. The painted arrows also help guide other Straw Hats who will follow.

events.title: Zoro vs Kaku Battle Continues
events.description: The episode shows the ongoing intense battle between Roronoa Zoro and Kaku. Both fighters exchange powerful blows, with Kaku using his Giraffe Devil Fruit powers and Zoro wielding his three-sword style. The fight demonstrates both combatants' strength and skill.
events.significance: This parallel battle to Sanji vs Jabra showcases Zoro's fight against CP9's second-strongest member. The ongoing nature of this fight builds anticipation for Zoro's eventual victory and demonstrates the Straw Hats' determination to rescue Robin.

events.title: Luffy vs Rob Lucci Battle Continues
events.description: The episode shows glimpses of the brutal ongoing battle between Monkey D. Luffy and Rob Lucci, the strongest member of CP9. Luffy shows frustration at his inability to get past Lucci, while Lucci continues to demonstrate his overwhelming power and Leopard Zoan abilities.
events.significance: This is the central battle of the Enies Lobby arc, representing Luffy's greatest challenge yet. The ongoing struggle emphasizes Lucci's strength and builds toward Luffy's eventual triumph. This fight will determine whether the Straw Hats can rescue Robin.

quotes.text: I really hate blood and fighting, you know...
quotes.speaker: Jabra
quotes.context: Jabra's deceptive lie to Sogeking before attacking

quotes.text: Who am I? I'm the hunter.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's dramatic introduction referencing Little Red Riding Hood

quotes.text: Leave his key to me. If you get there, you can definitely save Robin!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji encouraging Sogeking to continue to Robin

quotes.text: Robin... she's my long-lost younger sister! Please, you have to save her!
quotes.speaker: Jabra
quotes.context: Jabra's fabricated story attempting to trick Sanji

quotes.text: Did you really think I'd fall for such an obvious lie?
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji revealing he saw through Jabra's deception

quotes.text: We know how to get to the Gates of Justice! Follow us!
quotes.speaker: Chimney

themes.description: The episode heavily features Jabra's use of lies and deception as weapons, from tricking Sogeking into lowering his guard to attempting to manipulate Sanji with the fake sister story. Sanji's ability to see through these lies represents the triumph of truth over deception.
themes.symbolism: Jabra's wolf form symbolizes the deceptive predator from fairy tales, while Sanji as 'The Hunter' represents the force that exposes and defeats such deception. The Little Red Riding Hood imagery reinforces this theme of wolves hiding their true nature.
culturalReferences: Little Red Riding Hood fairy tale

themes.description: Sanji's trust in Sogeking to reach Robin despite his loss to Jabra demonstrates the crew's faith in each other's abilities. The episode shows how the Straw Hats support one another, with Sanji rescuing Usopp, Franky saving Chopper, and Chimney helping Franky.
themes.symbolism: The painted arrows Chimney leaves represent the connections between crew members, guiding each other toward their shared goal of rescuing Robin.

themes.description: The episode playfully references Little Red Riding Hood with Sanji as the hunter, Jabra as the wolf, and Robin portrayed in a red hood. However, it subverts the traditional tale by having the 'prey' (Sanji) be fully aware of the wolf's deception.
themes.symbolism: The fairy tale imagery creates a thematic framework for the battle between predator and protector, with Sanji ultimately filling the hero's role.

themes.description: Each Straw Hat continues fighting despite exhaustion and injuries. Chopper's recovery from Monster Point, Franky's determination to reach Robin, and Sanji taking on Jabra all demonstrate unwavering commitment to rescuing their friend.
themes.symbolism: The ongoing battles represent the crew's willingness to sacrifice their safety for Robin's freedom.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji demonstrates growth in tactical awareness by seeing through Jabra's psychological manipulation. His dramatic rescue of Sogeking and confident acceptance of the Jabra fight showcases his role as a protector and his trust in his crewmates.
keyActions: Rescues Sogeking from Jabra's killing blow
Introduces himself as 'The Hunter' in a fairy tale reference
Sees through Jabra's deceptive 'Robin is my sister' lie
Encourages Sogeking to continue to Robin while he handles Jabra
Begins his major battle against Jabra
quotes: Who am I? I'm the hunter.
Leave his key to me. If you get there, you can definitely save Robin!
Did you really think I'd fall for such an obvious lie?

characterSpotlights.development: Jabra is established as a cunning and deceptive fighter who uses psychological warfare alongside his physical abilities. His willingness to lie and manipulate shows his ruthless nature, contrasting with his feigned pacifism.
keyActions: Tricks and brutally attacks Sogeking with Jusshigan
Gets kicked away by Sanji's surprise entrance
Attempts to deceive Sanji with the fabricated Robin sister story
Begins his battle with Sanji after his deception fails
quotes: I really hate blood and fighting, you know...
Robin... she's my long-lost younger sister! Please, you have to save her!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being defeated by Jabra, Usopp (as Sogeking) demonstrates humility by apologizing to Sanji. His willingness to continue toward Robin after being saved shows his dedication to the mission despite his limitations.
keyActions: Falls for Jabra's pacifist deception
Gets brutally beaten by Jabra's Jusshigan attack
Is rescued by Sanji at the last moment
Apologizes to Sanji for not being strong enough
Continues toward Robin with renewed determination
quotes: I'm sorry, Sanji. I couldn't handle him...

characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates his growing bond with the Straw Hats by rescuing Chopper and rushing to save Robin. His quick thinking and determination show his commitment to the crew despite being a recent ally.
keyActions: Rescues unconscious Chopper from the sea
Revives Chopper by expelling water from his lungs
Receives guidance from Chimney about reaching the Gates of Justice
Races toward the Gates of Justice with two keys

characterSpotlights.development: Chimney's knowledge of Enies Lobby's layout proves crucial to the mission. Despite being a child, she takes initiative to help the Straw Hats by guiding Franky and marking the path for others.
keyActions: Informs Franky about the way to Gates of Justice
Guides Franky through the halls
Paints arrows to mark the path for others to follow
quotes: We know how to get to the Gates of Justice! Follow us!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scenes of Sanji and Jabra's initial exchanges, adding more dialogue and reaction shots to build tension before their fight begins.
The anime adds more footage of Zoro vs Kaku and Luffy vs Lucci happening simultaneously to emphasize the parallel battles occurring throughout Enies Lobby.
Franky's rescue of Chopper and the scene with Chimney is slightly expanded in the anime to give more screen time to these supporting characters.

trivia.fact: Episode 297 is the first episode of One Piece to air without an ending theme, as ending themes were discontinued after Episode 278 and wouldn't return until Episode 1071 in 2023, representing a 17-year gap.

The Little Red Riding Hood references in this episode (Sanji as 'The Hunter', Jabra as the wolf, Robin shown in a red hood) are anime-original visual additions, though the deception plot exists in the manga.
This episode adapts parts of Chapters 413 and 414 of the manga, covering approximately 1.5 chapters worth of content.

Jabra's Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf was first revealed in Episode 286, but this episode showcases the psychological aspects of his 'wolf' nature through deception, matching the predatory cunning of wolves in folklore.
The episode originally aired on February 11, 2007 in Japan but didn't reach US audiences until October 2013, representing over a 6-year delay for official English releases.
